1�Close observation of the sky reveals that the weather in this area today will be ???? with occasional ????. There is also a slight chance of ????, so caution is in order.

1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Darkness Descends(pt.1).Darkness Descends(pt.2).Adieu, Lilisette.Bonds of Mythril(pt.1).Bonds of Mythril(pt.2).Bonds of Mythril(pt.3).Bonds of Mythril(pt.4).Fork in the Road.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
4�Lilith!
1�We've come for Sir Ragelise and Portia! Return them to us now!
1�What?

1�Um...uh...Having, uh...gained m-momentum in their landmark victory at the Battle of Jeuno, the Allied Forces, um...m-marched on Xarcabard. There, they, uh...encircled and l-laid siege to Castle Zvahl, the beastman stronghold, in an operation h-helmed by Ragelise B Baloumat of the Kingdom of San d'Oria. <Phew>...
1�After which, the h-heroes of the, um...five races of Altana c-confronted and felled the Shadow Lord in the f-final encounter.
1�Wh-what!?
1�Th-then...how do you explain--
1�C-Cait Sith. What...what is she saying?
1�Wh-whatever did they do?
1�But...what about our future where the Crystal War was won?
1�So the memories of my childhood...of Mother and Father--even myself--they were all just...lies?
1�But if I'm not an illusion like she says, then what exactly am I?
1�Grrr! This is making me really--truly--mad!
1�Father! Mother!
1�A...nightmare...
1�It...it cannot be...
1�L-Larzos!?
1�<Gasp, pant>...
1�I come before you a man ostracized by his own, bereft of a place whereto I might return.
1�Fate has decreed that I must fight unto death.
1�I beseech you, Dark Divinity!6Grant me power the equal of the Shadow Lord...
1�...That I might sate my rage!
1�Listen, then, to what really happened. How history unfolded.It was the year 863...
1�The Allied Forces of Altana amassed on Xarcabard and commenced the siege of Castle Zvahl.But the might of the Beastman Confederate proved insurmountable. Too great to overcome.

1�The besiegers were quickly overwhelmed by those they had sought to smite, and were dealt a sound thrashing at the hands of the Shadow Lord. Nigh obliterated.Not dissimilar to the current situation.
1�In order to fight on even ground with the Shadow Lord, they forged an unholy pact with the Dark Divinity! Became the very thing they sought to destroy!
1�These tears carried her wish that Vana'diel might know peace--a wish that manifested itself as my regal kin and I. The caits.
1�For our first act, we roused the then-slumbering Atomos.
1�And thence traveled through the corridors of time, bearing a single objective: to plant the seeds of a Vana'diel free of the tidal wave of tears. Lessen the suffering.
1�With the prophesied Champions of the Dawn at our side, we hoped to slowly but surely alter the course of history.
1�Our preferred reality would prevail and displace the one of strife and chaos, which Atomos would then devour. Swallow whole.
1�The tug of war between two realities has entailed the mess before you. The chaos to which you bear witness.
1�Yes... I'm afraid so...
1�No! Don't you believe that for an instant! Perish the thought!
1�You must believe me! Trust in my words!You're no less real than Lilith and her minions!

1�A push to action here, a shove of encouragement there--that was the extent of our involvement. The caits' role.The future itself, however, was born from the hands, hopes, and dreams of the children of Altana!
1�Give no credit to the notion that your lives and memories are make-believe.You mustn't allow your resolve to waver, for that's exactly what the enemy desires! The weakness they seek to exploit!
1�Vile woman! Detestable wench!What do you mean to do to them!?
1�Th-that's...
1�Lilisette!Steady now, lass! Be strong!
1�Nyaaaaaah! Lilisette's--Lilisette's...b-b-been devoured!
1� ! It's far too dangerous to linger here!We retreat for now! Withdraw!
1�Shameless, willful child...
1�You are intruding upon a private moment. Have you no concept of propriety?
1�I was just in the midst of a most pleasant regaling...
1�Oh? You truly had no idea?This is deliciously rich, coming from a Champion of the Dawn.
1�Then do listen in, for there is much you're bound to learn.Am I not right, Cait Sith?
1�You, simpleton. You claim to have come from the future, yes?
1�If so, share with all present what you know of the Crystal War. How it concludes, for instance.
1�Ahahahahaha!
1�Only in a dream could a ragtag, pathetic excuse for a military alliance hope to overcome the Shadow Lord.Your kind might try for a thousand years and not once succeed.
1�The Crystal War was always a hopeless cause.One who stands among us has recently been made to keenly realize this fact.

1�How the Allies prevailed against the Confederate in your future? Why, the answer is remarkably simple.It's because your Vana'diel is an illusion, a world fabricated by that deceitful cat at Altana's behest.
1�But there were those who kept the fire of hope smouldering.
1�They bided their time and gathered strength, that they might rise up to reclaim that which had been reft from them.
1�These men and women are my kindred spirits. And I, the one chosen to lead them.
1�The end justifies the means. We chose to accept the gift of immortality, that we might ever continue our struggle in this unending conflict.
1�Hah. A story as foolish as it is long-winded.
1�Now do you see?
1�Our Vana'diel is the sole true future.
1�Yours is but a sham that owes its existence to the selfish whim of an irresponsible deity. By rights, it shouldn't even exist.
1�This mummer's farce will keep.Master shall soon grace us with his presence, and we must be ready to receive him.
1�We haven't the patience--nor the blind conviction--to await salvation by some petty deity.
1�We mean to reclaim the future with our own hands. To this end, we have acquired vessels to house the power of gods.
1�O Almighty Dark Divinity!6Great Odin, Devourer of Light!
1�You have nothing to fear. To those sworn to the Dark Divinity, the Astral Wind is but a gust that sets one's hair to dancing.
1�The mark you bear on your chest is proof positive of your allegiance to him.
1�The cry of a mortal's soul is that which calls forth the Dark Divinity.For it is the profoundest depths of emotions--those tempered in the forge of suffering--that he looks upon with favor.
1�Grief. Rage. Rancor. And finally...
1�Love.
!!�Odin judges the worthiness of all who come before him.
1�Vessels made of the strongest flesh, whose souls seethe with unbridled desire--it is through them that we shall attain greatest power!
1�Now, forge the pact! And with it, the seeds of all fraudulent futures shall be eradicated!
1�I am so proud of you, Father.
1�Father. Mother.
1�Am I not the daughter you had always envisioned? Superior in every conceivable way to that undersized, dim-witted slip of a girl?
1�Say that you agree...
1�I see you've taken it upon yourself to deprive me of two playing pieces.But no matter. Victory is never without sacrifice.
1�It would appear we still lack for one Spitewarden.
1�Someone who requires absolutely no introduction...
1�My final Spitewarden,  .
1�Now, if you would hear the plight of your daughter, she would beg a boon of you.That meddlesome cat, its insufferable companion, and the malefic will of Altana...
1�It is my heart's desire that these thorns in my side be forever expunged from reality...for all time!
1�Nooo! Th-this...can't be true! It...it isn't fair!
1�H-how could we...lose to weaklings...like them!?
1�H-Haudrale...
1�It seems...we were overmatched...
1�Champions of the Dawn...
1�Be it forgotten past...or distant future...our paths may yet cross...
1�Your reality...shall be consumed...When that time comes...we shall see you...in the void...
1�Please forgive us our many discourtesies, milord.Guidin' you on the right path necessitated our actions.
1�Quite so, milord, for it was in your union with Matron Portia that Lady Lilith was conceived.
1�Go forth, my knight, and set thy soul ablaze amidst the quenchless flames of Asgarth!
1�In ages past, I oft journeyed the boundless aethyr to pay visit this emerald isle.
1�Art thou he who hast summoned me?
1�Speak thy mind.
1�Honored to stand before you again, Sir Ragelise.
1�...It shall be done.
1�So this is the archfiend who commands the legions of shadow against us...
1�It's as good as done! Right,  ?
1�We'll find it, even if we have to tear every limb from your twisted body!
1�Zeid...? Zeid!
1�Watch out...!
1�Aye. Just a bit bruised, is all.And the captain?
1�So you finally found the answer you sought, Zeid...
1�I was yours once, but never again.When my captain found me, I vowed...never will I lose myself again.
.!�Volker!
1�Captain! Can you hear me!?Captain!
1�Captain!
1�Thank the Goddess you're safe...
1�You need rest, Captain.Let us make for the Republic.
1�Five Moons and I will hold the enemy here!You must find the jewel!
..�Volker! Are you all right!?
1�She is free of the fiend's spell.We've done it!
1�To think that Amon's Thrallstone was inside her all along... Zeid did well to destroy it.
1�Captain...
1�There's no end to them!
1�It was a miracle, I say!
1�Even...in my darkest hour...I knew...you would...find me...
1�Thank you, my friends. I owe you...everything.
1�My lord. We have brought the mortal.
1�Unbounded rage and thirst for power run deep in this one's veins.He will serve you most well, I assure you.
1�You will kneel in the presence of royalty, sniveling worms!
1�My lord. These mortals are as maggots squirming beneath the rubble.They are too wretched, too insignificant to even occupy the same space as Your Majesty.Leave them to me.
1�Well, well.Come to destroy my lovely Thrallstone, have we?
1�You are persistent, I'll give you that much.
1�But riddle me this: how does one go about destroying that which one cannot find?
1�Confident words from a maggot.But first, allow me a demonstration... Zeid!
1�Kill him.
1�Gwahahaha! Do you think he can hear you, worm!?Do you think he remembers your insignificant existence?He belongs to the Shadow Lord now!
1�Bwahahaha! Fight, maggots!!!As comrades spill the blood of comrades, so will shadow devour the realm!
1�What is the meaning of this!?Your soul was ours!
1�Curse you, mortals... You will pay for your lack of vision!
1�...Very well.
1�It is power you seek? Then power shall be yours.I grant it to you...by my own hand.
1�Amon. They are your guests, after all.The audience chamber is yours. You will extend to them our warmest hospitality...or else.
1�Pitiful creatures.I take my leave of you.
1�Then you are a fool, no better than they, and I do not suffer the company of fools.Begone from my sight.
1�But know this, mortals: where there is light, so always will there be shadow.For so long as hatred and rage festers in the hearts of Altana's children, e'er will my power grow.
